column4: Hello,l when encrypting the laptop with "use entire disk and set up encrypted LVM" How strong is this encryption?
where can i know for sure?

Someone else should take this if you're using the installer.  The manual setup instructions here give more detail on the possible ciphers:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EncryptedFilesystemLVMHowto
Is there any way to treat *multiple files* as a single block device when doing a loopback mount?
e.g. I have  /mnt/disk1/dd_image.1  and  /mnt/disk2/dd_image.2    and I want to mount dd_image.* as a loopback block device
hmm that link describes the encryption done with cryptsetup. I need to know how strong is the ubuntu encryption.. i think its 256? or 128?
Right, the installer should do it that way, just without showing you :)  I'm not an expert, but I would be very surprised if it weren't AES-128
(not an expert on ubuntu's installer; i'm pretty well-versed in crypto)
AES-128 is much faster than AES-256.  AES-256 is more secure, but it's not necessary to have that strong
no matter *what* you're doing on there :)
I need to encrypt it using AES 258. not 128
You can, you just have to manually set up using the instructions provided.  AFAIK, the installer won't let you choose.  Is there a reason why you need AES-256?
according to this http://www.cjlinux.com/system/installation/how-to-install-ubuntu-with-an-encrypted-file-system.html  it is 256 AES
So I'm wrong!  Thanks for double-checking.
